unnormalised: Delhi Jal Board Announces Hilarious New Meter Reading System
normalised: Delhi Jal Board Announces Hilarious New Meter Reading System

unnormalised: The Delhi Jal Board (DJB) has announced a revolutionary, and arguably comical, new system for reading water meters. Instead of the usual boring numbers, meters will now display consumption in terms of "Bathing Elephants" (BE). A DJB official explained, "1 BE equals approximately 500 litres. So, if your bill shows 2 BE, you’ve used 1000 litres, which means either you’re running a small water park or need to fix that leaky tap, bhai!" Residents are reportedly thrilled, though a few statistically challenged citizens have already lodged complaints, one grumbling that 0.5 BE is too vague.
normalised: The Delhi Jal Board (D-J-B) has announced a revolutionary, and arguably comical, new system for reading water meters. Instead of the usual boring numbers, meters will now display consumption in terms of "Bathing Elephants" (B-E). A D-J-B official explained, "one B-E equals approximately five hundred litres. So, if your bill shows two B-E, you’ve used one thousand litres, which means either you’re running a small water park or need to fix that leaky tap, bhai!" Residents are reportedly thrilled, though a few statistically challenged citizens have already lodged complaints, one grumbling that zero point five B-E is too vague.

unnormalised: The change comes after numerous complaints about the difficulty of understanding figures like "14,789 litres" on their bills. "Who even understands that?!" exclaimed a resident of Karol Bagh. “With BE, at least I can picture where my money is going – down the drain with a pachyderm party!" Initial tests, however, have revealed some teething problems. One resident confused BE with "Beer Equivalent," leading to a flurry of calls demanding clarity – and free beer.

It's just a fun, easily digestible way to visualize your water usage. Now go forth and conserve, or the elephants will revolt!" The initiative is expected to save 0.000001% water by sheer confusion, but the memes alone will be worth it, estimates at least 10000 LOLs generated on social media, making this, hands down, the most entertaining way to be billed in 2024!
